justification: The article states that “GUTs may serve as an index of behavioral exploitation,” defining the time from the last reward capture to leaving a patch as their operational measure.

measured_by: Residence times in the current display
justification: Residence time is treated as a behavioural marker, with the authors noting that longer residence times indicate ‘over-exploitation’ and correlate negatively with earnings, thus indexing the explore/exploit bias.

measured_by: Task-related BOLD signal (fMRI) in fronto-parietal attention network
justification: The study “recorded the task-related BOLD-signal” with the aim “to identify the neural correlates supporting exploratory shifts of attention,” using fMRI activity (particularly in frontopolar cortex and allied regions) as the measurement of neural exploration processes.
